intro: Ixora pedalis, commonly known as the redroot ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its root system is fibrous and often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Botanically, it belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes other flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value.
